text:
Marcia Louise Fudge (born October 29, 1952) is an American politician. She is the U.S. Representative from since 2008. She is a member of the Democratic Party.
Fudge was Chair of the Congressional Black Caucus in the 113th Congress.
In December 2020, Fudge was nominated by President-elect Joe Biden to serve as the United States Secretary of Housing and Urban Development.

annotations.surface_form: United States Secretary of Housing and Urban Development
